      • useDefaultPrimaryLocale

        public static void useDefaultPrimaryLocale()
        Call this to reset the primary locale to the system's default locale (the default value for the primary locale).

      • getI18nDirectory

        public static String getI18nDirectory()
        Returns:
        The name of the subdirectory where the translations are stored. Default: "i18n".

      • setI18nDirectory

        public static void setI18nDirectory(String i18nDirectory)
        For the locales to be correctly loaded, this should be called before enabling the component.
        Parameters:
        i18nDirectory - The name of the subdirectory where the translations are stored. Default: "i18n".

      • setJarFile

        public static void setJarFile(File jarFile)
        Sets the plugin's JAR file. Required if you don't use QuartzPlugin. For the locales to be correctly loaded, this should be called before enabling the component.
        Parameters:
        jarFile - A reference to the plugin's JAR file.

      • setUserFriendlyFormatting

        public static void setUserFriendlyFormatting(boolean userFriendlyFormatting)
        Enable the automatic replacement of user-friendly color codes in the strings.

        If enabled, the following codes will be available.

        • Every colors & formatting codes without underscores, written in english: 
                       {black}, {darkblue}, {darkgreen}, {darkaqua}, {darkred}, {darkpurple}, {gold}, {gray},
             {darkgray}, {blue}, {yellow}, {green}, {aqua}, {red}, {lightpurple}, {bold}, {strikethrough},
             {underline}, {italic}, {obfuscated}, {white}, {reset}
        • Some codes for some special types of messages: 
          {ce}, {ci}, {cs}, {cst}, {cc}
          (resp. error, information, success, status, command).
        Parameters:
        userFriendlyFormatting - false to disable. Enabled by default.
        See Also:
        setErrorColor(String), setNoticeColor(String), setSuccessColor(String), setStatusColor(String), setCommandColor(String)

      • setErrorColor

        public static void setErrorColor(String errorColor)
        Parameters:
        errorColor - The color (or formatting) used to replace {ce}. Default: red. null: no formatting.

      • setNoticeColor

        public static void setNoticeColor(String noticeColor)
        Parameters:
        noticeColor - The color (or formatting) used to replace {ci}. Default: white. null: no formatting.

      • setSuccessColor

        public static void setSuccessColor(String successColor)
        Parameters:
        successColor - The color (or formatting) used to replace {cs}. Default: green. null: no formatting.

      • setStatusColor

        public static void setStatusColor(String statusColor)
        Parameters:
        statusColor - The color (or formatting) used to replace {cst}. Default: gray. null: no formatting.

      • setCommandColor

        public static void setCommandColor(String commandColor)
        Parameters:
        commandColor - The color (or formatting) used to replace {cc}. Default: gold. null: no formatting.

      • addCountToParameters

        public static void addCountToParameters(boolean addCountToParameters)
        Parameters:
        addCountToParameters - if true, when a translation method with plurals is called without object parameters (the ones replacing {0}, {1}...), the count is added as the first (and only) parameter, as it will likely be used in the string and this avoid giving it twice. Default: true.

        Parameters:

      • loadFromJar

        public static void loadFromJar(String directory,
                               int priority)
        Loads the translations from the plugin's JAR file under the given directory (recursively).
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to scan inside the plugin's JAR.
        priority - The priority to set for this translator. Translators with a higher priority will be called first for a translation.

      • load

        public static void load(File file)
        Loads a file into the translations system.

        If this file is a directory, all files inside will be loaded, recursively.

        The locale will be extracted from the file name, and the format, from the file's extension.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to load.

      • load

        public static void load(File file,
                        int priority)
        Loads a file into the translations system.

        If this file is a directory, all files inside will be loaded, recursively.

        The locale will be extracted from the file name, and the format, from the file's extension.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to load.
        priority - The priority to set for this translator. Translators with a higher priority will be called first for a translation.

      • registerTranslator

        public static void registerTranslator(Locale locale,
                                      Translator translator,
                                      int priority)
        Registers a translator into the translations system.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to register this translator for.
        translator - The translator.
        priority - The priority to set for this translator. Translators with a higher priority will be called first for a translation.

      • translate

        public static String translate(Locale locale,
                               String context,
                               String messageId,
                               String messageIdPlural,
                               Integer count,
                               Object... parameters)
        Translates the given string using the given locale.

        If the given locale is null, tries to use the primary locale; fallbacks to the fallback locale if the string cannot be translated; fallbacks to the input text if the string still cannot be translated.

        The count is likely to be used in the string, so if, for a translation with plurals, only a count is given, this count is also interpreted as a parameter (the first and only one, {0}). If this behavior annoys you, you can disable it using addCountToParameters(boolean).

        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to use to translate the string.
        context - The translation context. null if no context defined.
        messageId - The string to translate.
        messageIdPlural - The plural version of the string to translate. null if this translation does not have a plural form.
        count - The count of items to use to choose the singular or plural form. null if this translation does not have a plural form.
        parameters - The parameters, replacing values like {0} in the translated string.
        Returns:
        The translated text, with the parameters replaced by their values.

      • translate

        public static String translate(String context,
                               String messageId,
                               String messageIdPlural,
                               Integer count,
                               Object... parameters)
        Translates the given string.

        Tries to use the primary locale; fallbacks to the fallback locale if the string cannot be translated; fallbacks to the input text if the string still cannot be translated.

        The count is likely to be used in the string, so if, for a translation with plurals, only a count is given, this count is also interpreted as a parameter (the first and only one, {0}). If this behavior annoys you, you can disable it using addCountToParameters(boolean).

        Parameters:
        context - The translation context. null if no context defined.
        messageId - The string to translate.
        messageIdPlural - The plural version of the string to translate. null if this translation does not have a plural form.
        count - The count of items to use to choose the singular or plural form. null if this translation does not have a plural form.
        parameters - The parameters, replacing values like {0} in the translated string.
        Returns:
        The translated text, with the parameters replaced by their values.

        public static Locale getPrimaryLocale()
        Returns:
        the primary locale set, or null if unset.

        public static void setPrimaryLocale(Locale locale)
